text:
When doing LDAP authentication with non-LDAP authorization, mod_authnz_ldap will
return 401 during authorization even when no LDAP authorization is configured.

Other authz modules, even when configured as authoritative, will not return
HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED if they don't see any of their specific flavor of authz
directives in the config (they essentially treat this as a hint that they aren't
authoritative in that context without requiring the explicit authoritative flag)

This prevents "require valid-user" to work with LDAP authentication without
setting 'AuthzLDAPAuthoritative' in the same context
